title: Saying KYS (Kill Youself) is NOT ACCEPTABLE
body:
I encounter more and more frequently players who whimsically use this term.  I can handle the normal rage, being called an idiot, retard, etc.  But having personal experiences with loved ones who have actually committed suicide, this one really pushes my buttons.  IT IS NOT OK TO TELL SOMEONE TO KILL THEMSELF.  It is a VERY serious thing to say and I think the punishment should reflect that.  RIOT, PLEASE HEAR ME- toxicity is one thing, but this is a whole new level and deserves to be treated as such.  

I ask that you permanently ban anyone who exhibits this behavior.  What if some young person feels so badly that they actually do it? When I point this out, it's often met with: "good, I hope they do it, I'm serious."  It makes my skin crawl that this younger generation actually thinks it's ok to say things like this.  PLEASE RIOT, DO SOMETHING ABOUT THIS. Lead by example.  Telling a fellow human being to take their own life over a video game makes me so sad that I don't even have the words to express my grief. IT IS NOT OK.

If you care at all about the League Community please respond to this at the very least, even if you don't have an immediate solution.  It would really mean a lot. Thank you.

-Dan

replies.body: This very definitely gets people banned, already.
Yes but I think it deserves a severe and swift punishment, in a category of its own
Why? Because it upsets you? That's not a good reason. I agree people shouldn't just be throwing it out there, but why does it require special treatment?

No, not because it upsets me. It's not about me, it's about the community. I simply posit that saying "kill yourself" is _categorically_ different than saying, for example, "fuck you." Maybe you disagree, and I'm fine with that. So let me instead ask you: why do you think that saying "kill yourself" is **not** different than the many other insults that are thrown around? From my perspective, it's not an insult at all, it's just...very dark. 

-Dan

How are they the same? They are things that people say to inflict emotional harm on others.

I agree that it isn't okay. I agree that it's a pretty dark thing to say, and I don't think most people that throw it about don't appreciate how dark it actually is.  I just don't think there's anything someone could say that  should get someone an instant ban. That's why we have the escalating punishments. Give them a chat restriction to let them know it's not okay (because for some reason there are actually people out there that don't know it's not), and if they continue after that, then the punishment gets worse. 

Let me ask you this: Is telling someone "KYS" worse than wishing cancer on someone (or whatever other horrible thing someone can come up with)? What objectively makes one worse than the other?

And if you're going to start handing out permanent bans for telling someone to kill themselves, what about just telling someone that you hope they die? Is that worth an instant permaban? What if you just tell someone to do something terrible to themselves that doesn't result in death? If I told you to go stick your hand in a garbage disposal, is that worth an instant ban? Where is the line between instant permaban and a chat restriction, and how do you objectively decide where it lies?

You make a good point, and I see now why we have escalating bans. Still, I see a lot of contempt from players regarding just that- people think that they will never get banned or punished, and I have no way of knowing if they were.  So it leaves a bad taste in my mouth after finishing a game with someone outrageously toxic, because for all I know they are just moving on to the next game, ruining the experience for more people (I know, I know, just mute them.  But then I'm awful confused because it seems like players are then just talking to themselves lol =P).
It's true though, when you wish self harm on another person it is a grey area, because there are many levels of severity (like your garbage disposal example). I guess deciding the objectivity is a topic of debate for the people making the rules.  So, my original objection boils down to the fact that the report and punishment system is ineffective; racism, flaming, and general toxicity are just too prevalent in League.  My seeing "go KYS" everywhere was just the catalyst that finally made me make this post.  I'll think on it, and get back to you. Appreciate the discussion.

-Dan

Hey Dan, 

I gave your post a like, because I agree it's not a good thing. However your** hypocrisy** kind of pushes MY buttons. I find it oddly amusing that you find other things that don't exactly relate to you personally offensive and you have no worries with those things, but as soon as it offends you. "Oh no that shouldn't be allowed to be said"


What really you should be advocating for is ANY form of harmful words whether that be Racism or Belittling or Suicide jokes or Bomb jokes. Instead you took a very low road in only condemning the acts that offend you personally when in fact those other words probably affect a lot of other people personally as well.

Thanks for the like, I gave you one as well.  I see your point, but I don't fully agree or see it as hypocrisy.  I didn't say I have no issues with those things (retard, %%%got, etc.), I only said that I can usually brush them aside and not let it get to me. I fully agree that none of it should go on.  My argument is simply that the KYS issue is a thing aside from all the other griefing that goes on, given the severity.  Thanks for the reply

I just want to say to you that I think you're right, my original post came off as too personal.  But I stick up for people ALL the time, when they are being bullied and picked on, no matter the insult, no matter how badly they are playing.  I don't stand for any of it, so it's really not hypocrisy.  The KYS thing is just what prompted me to finally make a post, as it kept coming up over and over; and upon reflection, I realized that it truly is different, because it applies to _everyone_. While I certainly condemn all forms of toxicity, this one really stands out to me.  And in the face of a sound argument, I am open minded enough to change my way of thinking, admit my faults, and continue a dialogue.  I don't think that's a low road at all.  So, what can we do about it?  I always add friendly people that I play with so I can play with them again, and it works pretty well, but I can't control the enemy team, except to mute them. Thoughts?

-Dan
